reaction due to a lack of water such as wilt or discoloration. Signs conversely are an indication
of something that is causing the problem. These are residual effects to the presence of the
cause of the disorder. This may include discarded skins, holes, conks, or fruiting bodies.

The answer is (B)

Solution 332

The death and decay of cells and tissue are called necrosis.

The answer is (A)




                                                 181
 Solution 333

Fungi growth is common and can be associated with a number of symptoms including powdery
mildew, rust colorization, and swollen plant tissue. Gummosis is the leaking of sap and is most
likely due to open physical wounds.

The answer is (B)

Solution 334

The majority of tree disorders are caused by environmental factors and not the result of living
threats.

The answer is (C)

Solution 335

Deformed or misshapen leaves are often the result of an outside influence affecting the proper
growth of the leaves. This may be due to causes such as frost, virus, bacteria, herbicide, insects,
and others. A mechanical injury may affect the ability of the leaves to get the proper water but
would be more so associated with wilting and would not create a distortional effect.

The answer is (A)

Solution 336

Soil PH can be identified as being associated with discolorations of foliage, often a yellow-green
color may be present.

The answer is (D)

Solution 337

The lack of or excessive amount of water can cause a tree to deteriorate to the point of death
within a year. These issues need to be identified quickly and addressed.

The answer is (A)




                                               182
 Solution 338

Frost cracks are due to the uneven cooling of the outer to the inner portion of the tree due to
rapid decreases in temperature. This uneven cooling may cause cracks allowing for the
intrusion of pathogens.

The answer is (C)

Solution 339

Allelopathy is a characteristic some plants have that is the release of chemicals that affect
surrounding plants which may be either beneficial or detrimental. This can occur from the living
plant or as a part of the decomposition process. This is not to be confused with resource
competition.

The answer is (B)

Solution 340

Pollution damage is difficult to identify and is often the result of long sustained exposure to
small concentrations. The most likely location of symptoms occurs on the foliage.

The answer is (A)

Solution 341

Damage due to insects is most often the result of feeding on the parts of the tree or laying eggs
that have a detrimental effect.

The answer is (A)

Solution 342

A skeletonized leaf is a common sign of the presence of Japanese beetles.

The answer is (B)

Solution 343

Insecticidal soaps are used to prevent against soft-bodied insects. They break down membranes
after repeated applications to eliminate the infestation.

The answer is (C)


                                                183
 Solution 344

Vascular diseases are often fatal by affecting the ability of the tree to bring water from the
roots to the necessary parts of the tree.

The answer is (D)

Solution 345

Once infection occurs, it is most often the case that the disease cannot be eliminated.

The answer is (D)

Solution 346

Biological control of pests includes the use of predators, parasites, or pathogens to control the
population. These are natural remedies that may be used in many areas including urban or
environmentally sensitive ones. The process, however, can take time to develop and does not
have the immediate response that the use of pesticides would.

The answer is (B)

Solution 347

The Appropriate Response Process (ARP) is an iterative process that incorporates all of the
factors needed to formulate a plan for health. It considers the client’s needs, the plant’s health,
and the outside stressors to evaluate the situation and determine an appropriate response.

The answer is (D)

Solution 348

A tree’s natural defenses can adapt to adversity and emerge stronger. But this is only true up to
a point at a moderate level of stressors. If there is too much damage, the tree may not be able
to recover and will become weaker as a result.

The answer is (A)

 Solution 349

When determining an appropriate choice of tree, it is important to incorporate the knowledge
of the tree’s ability to thrive in the environment. Vitality relates to a tree’s ability to succeed in
a specific environment. Vigor relates to a tree’s genetic ability to resist stress.

The answer is (C)

Solution 350

There are three types of implementation methods for biological control:

   •   Augmentation: helping the existing population by supplementing their needs
   •   Introduction: providing a new species to a population in hopes of natural control
   •   Conservation: taking measures to maintain the existing population

The answer is (B)

Solution 351

Bracing can be done by using either lag-threaded or machine-threaded rods. The procedure for
use of lag-threaded rods is to drill a hole entirely through the smaller stem and halfway through
the larger.

The answer is (C)

Solution 352

Sunscald is most commonly found on the south side of the trunk in the northern hemisphere
and on the north side in the southern hemisphere.

The answer is (D)

Solution 353

A phenology calendar is used to track the development of pests. This can help in determining
appropriate levels and actions based on the observed trends.

The answer is (B)

An action threshold is a number based on pest population densities and is a marker for
determining if the level is acceptable or if action should be taken.

The answer is (A)

Solution 355

Trees have a strong role in controlling emissions by sequestering CO2 through all of its parts and
storing it. This is somewhat offset by maintenance and care activities. Also during
decomposition, stored CO2 is then released back into the air.

Solution 356

There are a number of benefits that can be seen economically from the presence and proper
maintenance of trees. These include higher property and asset values, increased tax base, and
more attractive business areas.

Solution 357

The replacement cost method of an appraisal will take into account the cost to replace a tree in
question. This may be difficult in rare situations that have little precedent. It is often a useful
tool for common trees that are damaged or need to be replaced.

The answer is (C)

Solution 358

The basic reproductive cost is a calculation of a predetermined cost per area and the area of
the tree. The area of the tree can be approximated by a circle:

                               = $ % = $5% = 78.5 -2              ℎ

The cost can then be determined by: BRC = 78.5($38.17) = $2,996.

The answer is (B)

 Solution 359

Tree ordinances establish the requirements for the proper conduct related to tree maintenance
and care in the jurisdiction. It shall establish the requirements, penalties, and authority. Some
ordinances, however, will affect trees without mentioning trees or plant life.

Solution 360

A tree preservation order is used to protect trees from removal or damage from outside
activities. This may be common in newly developed areas of construction or from improper
maintenance in existing areas.

The answer is (C)

Solution 361

It is often recommended to maintain the following maximums within populations to establish
proper diversity:

   •   30% of a single plant family
   •   20% of a single genus
   •   10% of a single species

Solution 362

Specifications are project-specific documents that provide contractual language and details for
the completion of a job. Best management practices may be referenced or encouraged but are
not a part of specification packages.

The answer is (C)

Solution 363

The tree inventory identifies and tracks the town assets by cataloging the characteristics of
each specific tree. This includes physical characteristics, location, and any specific requirements
to maintain the tree. It does not identify ordinances that will apply to the tree.

The answer is (B)

 Solution 364

The civil infrastructure consists of roads, bridges, and other built assets. This will begin to
depreciate immediately as wear and tear begins to take up its life cycle. The green
infrastructure, however, will appreciate over time as plants and trees grow more mature.

The answer is (B)

Solution 365

A tree is identified as a hazard if an assessment has determined that a present condition will
create a threat to an identified target and there is mitigation that can be performed to
eliminate the risk.

The answer is (B)

Solution 366

The process of composting is the breaking down of organic material by microorganisms. This
process gives off heat that kills pathogens and other intrusive elements in the soil leaving a rich
byproduct.

The answer is (C)

Solution 367

Tree support systems are a means to strengthen an existing element of a tree that is potentially
hazardous. The risk, however, can only be reduced, and it should be noted that the potential for
failure cannot be eliminated.

The answer is (A)

Solution 368

There are generally three choices for the cable type when using a tree support system:

   •   7-strand common-grade: Lower strength and flexible
   •   Extra-high-strength: High in strength lower in flexibility
   •   Aircraft: High strength and flexibility but limited in the choices of anchorage

The answer is (C)




                                                 188
 Solution 369

There are two types of anchors for the attachment of cables to branches: bolts and screws.
Bolts such as eyebolts shall have a hole drilled 1/16 to 1/8 inch larger than the hardware
diameter and all the way through the branch to be fastened with a nut and washer. Screws are
installed with a smaller pilot hole partially through the tree member.

The answer is (B)

Solution 370

The use of tree support systems strengthens the tree against undesirable structural conditions.
This may include codominant stems, decayed unions, or flared multi-stemmed trees. The root
system that is anchoring a tree, however, may not be solved by the use of a support system.

The answer is (B)

Solution 371

A properly installed J-hook shall have the J-loop installed vertically and can be either up or
down.

The answer is (D)

Solution 372

Due to the lack of flexibility for an extra-high-strength cable, an eye splice cannot be formed
and a dead-end grip is used instead.

The answer is (B)

Solution 373

The cable system should be installed at 2/3 the distance from the weak point to the end of the
limbs. This distance can be found by subtracting the height to the weak point from the overall
height: 82’ – 38’ = 44’. Then two-thirds of this distance is the location of the cable: 2/3 x 44 =
29.33’. Then add this to the height of the weak point to get the distance to the ground: 38’ +
29.33’ = 67.33. Rounding up gives 68’.

The answer is (D)

 Solution 374

It is advisable to have no less than 30% sound wood of the branch diameter when installing
anchors.

Solution 375

Cable configurations for multiple branches require multiple cables. The triangular configuration
provides the added strength necessary but limits the potential movement.

The answer is (A)

Solution 376

The tree to be supported shall be anchored above the midpoint to a point below the midpoint
of the anchoring tree.

The answer is (B)

Solution 377

The conductor run shall be buried no less than 8” underground.

The answer is (B)

Solution 378

The likelihood of a tree getting struck by lightning can be increased by the height and location
of the tree. The tallest tree in a group, those near water or woods, or on hilltops is at a higher
risk than others.

Solution 379

It is acceptable to establish a target zone with a radius equal to the height of the tree. Any
targets that fall within the zone need to be evaluated for mitigation.

A tree’s risk is an evaluation of both the likelihood of an event happening and the severity of
the consequences if a failure occurs.

Solution 381

Mitigation efforts should be exhausted before choosing to remove the tree. This includes the
removal or relocation of the target.

The answer is (D)

Solution 382

While sometimes associated with deciduous trees, brown rot is more often present in conifers.

Solution 383

The trunk with an ideal taper for structural integrity shall be wider at the base with a decreasing
diameter.

The trunk flare is the intersection of the trunk and the roots and is a specific point of interest
for the overall structural integrity of the tree.

Branch assessment should evaluate the size, structure, and alignment. Strong branches are no

To identify decay in tree members, acoustic measuring devices can be used by measuring the

decayed than sound wood.

Solution 387

There are a number of decay measuring techniques that require a significant cost or expertise.
One of the less limiting options is resonance testing. This only requires a mallet or hammer to

The initial visual tree assessment (VTA) is the standard minimum level of required evaluation

indication of larger problems. The tree shall be identified, and any existing conditions noted

but extensive evaluations including the removal of dirt are down as a result of the VTA.

Risk mitigation is specifically tied to reducing the potential for the failure of a tree which may
cause harm to an identified target.

Often it is best to perform no action on an area of decayed wood. Ideally, the tree will be
healthy enough to naturally compartmentalize the area. Removal of decayed wood may impose
damage on the surrounding healthy wood and fillers are often not recommended. The cavity
should be evaluated as to the effect of the overall structural integrity, but most often it is best

 Solution 391

The standard of care is a barometer for the degree of care a reasonable person would be
expected to provide in a given situation. It is a standard level of conduct used to compare
against situations in question. It can be a moving target, but it is determined by standard
practice, expert witness, and local and national requirements. The level of experience of the
individual is not an excuse for falling below the standard of care. All professionals need to be
aware of safety and liability.

The answer is (C)

Solution 392

Negligence is a failure to exercise due care. The tree professional has a duty to maintain the
safety of others or objects in relation to the maintenance, treatment or removal of a tree in
question. Failing to do so is a failure to exercise due care.

The answer is (A)

Solution 393

The ISA basic risk assessment form has a table to help assess the risk of a specific tree. The risk
matrix is based on the likelihood of an event and the consequences of that event happening. A
rating of extreme is the highest risk factor and is only established with a very likely likelihood of
occurring combined with a severe consequence of occurring.

The answer is (D)

Solution 394

In response to lean, a tree will develop reaction wood as an offset.

The answer is (D)

Construction activities disturb the soil and areas around trees which has a significant impact on

A J-hook shall be installed so that the end of the loop is contacting the bark.

While all construction activities should be evaluated and concerning, those most often causing

The specifications of the project are a binding contract where requirements must be followed

Engineered fill is used to create a stable base for structures above. Therefore, it is more easily
